website_summaries.verdict: Not intended for quick charging, but to charge infrequently-used batteries and keep them ready-to-go without overcharging or damaging them.
pros: Quick-connect harness for hard to reach areas
Can leave on battery, unattended for months, keeping it ready until it's needed
Designed to fully charge a battery and maintain it at proper storage voltage without damage typically caused by trickle chargers
Temperature compensated to ensure optimum charge voltage according to ambient temperature
Automatically switches from full charge to float charging mode
Reverse-polarity protection to ensure user safety

website_summaries.verdict: Provides a fast and safe means of charging batteries, while outperforming larger battery chargers.
pros: Adjusts its charging properties once the proper voltage is reached to ensure a safe process
Will adjust charging process based on the temperature in the area
Runs through a 4-step charging process that simplifies the work
Includes safety measures to prevent battery damage
cons: Doesn't contain accessories needed for all types of batteries

customer_reviews.title: Funds wasted.
customer_reviews.text: New battery tender plus purchased as a replacement. As an electrician, this unit is properly installed on a new fully charged battery reading 12.7V. The battery tender plus should be reading a steady green in this environment. However, it constantly reads a flashing red...indicating that the unit not properly connected....which is not the case. Suspect an internal wiring or circuit problem on the battery tender itself. VENDOR HAS IGNORED MY REQUEST FOR SERVICE AND CORRECTIONS!...Funds wasted.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: After leaving this on my car all winter, it ...
customer_reviews.text: After leaving this on my car all winter, it didn't keep the battery charged. I thought it may have been my hook up but I asked a shop to show me how to connect and it wouldn't work for them either. I'm hoping for a response here to try to replace this item as link to return is no longer active.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna F.

customer_reviews.title: Out of box does not work. Company support will ...
customer_reviews.text: Out of box does not work. Company support will not return emails. Did not have opportunity to try before return period expired. Unpackaged new product for the first time and unit sends no current of any type through leads (it does have power at the plug). Attempted to contact/get reply from manufacturer and NO RESPONSE AT ALL. What a POS unit and disgraceful customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple of months, then just stopped charging. The lights go on, but no one is home. Would have been a great product if the quality held up, but since it doesn't, save yourself the loss.
customer_reviews.author: travelingbean

customer_reviews.title: i "inherited" a boat and various equipment including a brand ...
customer_reviews.text: i "inherited" a boat and various equipment including a brand new battery...never used. But it sat in my garage for more than a year and I wondered what condition it would be in when I tried to charge it. Bought this charger and it showed a steady red light for almost 2 days so I thought it might be flakey. Then it went to green so all is well! UPDATE:12/31/2017 - The unit no longer works. No lights at all. Nothing. Guess I jumped the gun on this as I wrote a positive review (above) in the first few days of ownership but it died. Wasted my money after all.
customer_reviews.author: JimMc

customer_reviews.title: This charger destroyed two of my batteries...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to keep a 12volt auto battery topped up...not installed. It worked well for a number of years, then it failed and toasted my expensive battery. Returned it still on warranty and got another one, used it to keep my small lawn and garden 12volt topped up, it worked well for a couple of years, and two days ago I discovered it had toasted that battery also. Both were kept in the garage and basically monitored every time I left and returned home. I use a BatteryMinder to keep my auto installed battery topped up for years and have had absolutely NO problems with it. I wont be buying another Battery Tender....EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Deltran Battery Tender Plus Problem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product on 02-28-2015 and worked fine up until recently. Now when I hook it to my battery, both lights (red and green) come on steady when I plug it into a wall outlet. I've tried hooking it to another battery with the same results. I tried contacting Deltran with no luck. The Battery Tender Plus supposedly has a five year warranty which is good until 02-28-2020. I don't understand why I can't get any help with this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Torrie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR MY 2016 HARLEY DAVIDSON 1200XL
customer_reviews.text: I got this because the battery on my 2016 Harley Davidson forty-eight died from me not riding enough. My bike already had the plug for me to just connect the tender too, so i needed a tender that had the connection. This had it! After having it plugged in overnight, BAM! Im riding again! Love the ease of use and the indicator lights. We'll see how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Does it work? Not!
customer_reviews.text: Plugged up to a Altima RV battery and charged for 3 day's, red light stayed on as if charging. Unhooked the charger, took battery to local auto zone and they said it was good at 85% power. Unit is supposed to flash green when over 80%, unit stayed red. Had auto zone charged to 100% hooked unit up, still solid red light. Can't trust unit, returning. Wouldn't recommend based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: wayne hodgkins

customer_reviews.title: NOT SO GREAT!! HAD TO RETURN BECAUSE IT GETS VERY HOT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: HAD TO RETURN IT BECAUSE OF EXCESSIVE HEAT!! I have used this charger in the past, but something must have changed in the latest process. Had it plugged in 1 day and it got so HOT, I thought it would create a fire hazard. Manufacturer needs to check to see if these are safe to use!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it !
customer_reviews.text: Applied charger as instructed in the manual. It charged the dead car battery for 2 minutes , then green and red lights blink alternately. Checked instuctions, double checked, battery on charge for 16 hours, still a dead battery. Brought battery to place of purchase and they charged battery no problem. This unit returned to Amazon after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Geo51

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT CHARGE A DEAD BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: This unit will not charge a dead (or very low) battery. This really is false advertising, as their info leads you to believe it will. You don't find this out until you buy the unit. See photo from the manual.
customer_reviews.author: LAUGH5

customer_reviews.title: Keeps car charged, even when car is not in use
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this device. I am retired and do not drive my car very often. I needed a new battery six months after it was replaced. My son in law had to come over and jump start my car. I then let my grandson drive it to college (about 40 miles away) to make sure it was charging. I lived in Minot, North Dakota and I remember havin to plug in the car when it was in the garage. I turned to Amazon and found this battery tender. I keep my car plugged in,and it starts every time. If you need a way to keep your battery charged, then this is the device.
customer_reviews.author: JeanneOH

customer_reviews.title: Do not use this product!
customer_reviews.text: I am sorely disappointed in this. I used this device as recommended and thought things were going well. Recently, I had an issue where my bike wouldn't start and I had to get it towed to a repair shop. They discovered that this charger had overcharged my voltage regulator and melted wiring and now I'm out $600. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jon clark

customer_reviews.title: The batter Charger did not work the very first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: The batter Charger that was sent to me is defective and did not work the very first time I used it.. I left it on a battery for nearly 24 hours and the red light indicated it was charging, while the literature said it would take 10 hours to fully charge a low battery. I finally gave up and jumped it and the car started up the first time just fine.
customer_reviews.author: bon vivant

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do diddly
customer_reviews.text: My car wouldn't start. I bought the Battery Tender Plus, took my car's battery out, and charged it for 3 days (other reviewers having said that's how long it takes to charge a battery from dead). Put the battery back in and my car still wouldn't start. Tested the "recharged" battery with a battery tester – completely dead. Nothing to show for three days of charging.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: bad tender
customer_reviews.text: bought it May 31, just opened the package and it does not work. I have a NEW fully charged and TESTED battery and the unit is getting HOT and the red light does not go to green to show fully charge
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Junk, DO NOT PURCHASE!!...
customer_reviews.text: Four of these hooked up to four motorcycle s, noticed two of them the green light not on...One of the motorcycles started, the other one ('81 Goldwing) has a dead battery (bought that Battery Tender November 8 2019...Found a couple older Schumacher float chargers and hooked them up, hoping I don't have to buy another brand new battery for the Goldwing due to this junk float charger.. Already out about $100 with two dead Battery Tenders....Deltran will never see another dime from me....
customer_reviews.author: Bassdude404

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge a 'deeply discharged' battery.  Returns are NOT free.
customer_reviews.text: Due to the Covid situation I haven't been driving and my car battery drained to the point where it will not start. The battery is not old and is not defective. I bought this device thinking it would charge and maintain my battery so that this problem will not occur again. Inside-the-package documentation says that it won't charge a battery that is drained below a certain point. THANKS FOR TELLING ME THIS UP FRONT. Now I am required to pay for shipping as part of the return process. THAT IS NOT A FREE RETURN as stated on Amazon's site. Very dissatisfied with both Deltran and Amazon for the waste of time and money this has been for me.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Charges ALL winter
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2. The feature I liked on this is that it does NOT shut of after 30 minutes so I can keep my summer sports cars charging all winter
customer_reviews.author: david's pic

customer_reviews.title: All 3 Battery Tender Plus are now dead!
customer_reviews.text: All 3 Battery Tender Plus are now dead! I purchased 2 in the summer of 2009 and my father purchased 1 in the fall of 2009. The last one died this June. When plugged in both lights flash. The last one had a green light on my truck battery for about a week and then went back to red so I unplugged it and then plugged it back in. Both lights started flashing just like the other 2. It's a good thing I checked the battery every couple of days or it might have over charged it. The warranty is a joke and I'm not sinking anymore money into junk. Do not buy a China made Battery Tender Plus.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ousnamer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your battery up
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect solution for those of us who are limiting our travel due to the pandemic. My car can sit in my garage for a week or more since I am not driving much. Your car's computer(s) are always drawing current, engine running or not. Without a continual trickle charge like this device provides, your battery can go dead. Especially if it is old and has a weak cell or two. One caveat: This device may be difficult to hook up if you do not garage your car. It is not meant to be outdoors. Since I garage my car, it works perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Palmer

customer_reviews.title: It won't charge a flat battery.
customer_reviews.text: I own a convertible that I should have driven occasionally over the winter, but didn't. My brattery drained completely so I bought this product to avoid jump starting it. The wording in the title and in the description made me think it would charge a flat battery, but the instruction manual specifically states that the battery must have at least 3V before charging will even begin. This would have been nice information to put on the product page. I'll hold on to it because I will probably need it next winter to keep my battery from completely draining again, but it did not serve the purpose that I actually bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only missing one thing that would make it a 5 star..
customer_reviews.text: This unit has a safety feature that will only turn on the trickle charge if it detects a 3v charge on the battery. This prevents the neg/pos terminals from arcing/sparking if they happen to touch before plugging them onto the battery. If your battery is totally drained, you will be screwed. It would be nice to have a toggle for this unit where you could turn this off and allow the charge to start even if there is no voltage detected. I got around this by jumping the car once again, letting it run for 20 minutes, and THEN hooking up the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob H

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: A shadow of the older original Battery Tender Plus I bought 5 years ago. This charger lacks the ability to give the long slow trickle charge my older one does after a ‘full’ charge light. It goes from charging to ‘full’( 80%)?, a very brief flashing green right to full green. After this unit said the battery was 100% fully charged I put my original Battery tender plus on it, it went into the trickle charge mode and was still charging when I left an hour later. This tells me it is not doing the slow trickle charge to keep battery at optimal strength.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Dettling

customer_reviews.title: DMC-12 use
customer_reviews.text: Used for a DMC-12 that spends a lot of time in garage storage that never get's down to freezing. I opted for this separate unit, opposed to the multi-charger units, as a failure doesn't shut down all the vehicles/motos at one time. It works as a Battery tender should, and it's one of 6 reliable performing one's ... a couple that are going on 10 years of continuous use. Cheers Update: July 2020. The Charger has failed, and has a constant red light, even with a known good battery. A multimeter test shows no charging current. Attempted to call Deltran, and the phone is a message that hangs up on you, with no opportunity for VM or tree-search contact.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Update to previous review
customer_reviews.text: Previous, I said: "The green light never came on -- should have flashing indicates 80% charged, steady indicates full charge. Over charged battery in my new ATV. My old Battery tender was OK until the transformer went out. New ones not good!" Turns out I didn't leave it on long enough. Being only 1.25 amps, it takes a very long time to charge even any battery -- took mine over night to charge a NEW ATV battery. Finally, after many hours of charging, the green light finally came on. I had an old Battery tender charger that worked much better than the latest models, but the new ones are really poor.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Heath

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep cars charged
customer_reviews.text: These devices are safe and easy to use and offer plenty of cord length. The major problem with this battery tender device is a simple one: it doesn’t consistently charge! I tried four of these on four different vehicles (Subaru Forester, BMW M3, Porsche 911 and BMW 320) and it only charged one vehicle sometime (Porsche) but most of the time it failed to keep the cars charged. Even the Porsche suffered from a dead battery eventually. I now use CTEK battery tender devices and they work flawlessly. They are more expensive but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mysecretavatar

customer_reviews.title: Great Equipment - Poor Performance
customer_reviews.text: My current "Battery Tender" unit just quit working! This is the third one I have replaced in a very short time. This unit lasted only16 months. The second time one failed I wrote the replacement date on the charger ... do the same if you buy one, you will be surprised. I have trickle chargers on all my batteries ... in my opinion and in my experience, Battery Tenders just do not have built-in quality. I do not want to promote any brand of charger, but I think that evaluation of performance is critical in deciding what to buy. I am extremely disappointed in the performance of these units.
customer_reviews.author: bmrdoc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I won five of them for all my vehicles. The most surprising thing is that my motorcycle battery is from 2003, and still going strong - honestly. When I return home, I just plug it back in, and forget about it until my next ride. The other four are on house generator starter battery, Sports car, second motorcycle, and everyday "under the radar" car. I swear by these things. If any f the five die, I will immediately replace it again with the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Teez

customer_reviews.title: Huge limitation
customer_reviews.text: I liked these chargers until recently, when I left something on on my motorcycle, and it dropped the battery to around 9 volts. These chargers WILL NOT recover a dead battery once the voltage drops beyond a certain point. They will alternately flash the red and green LED's, and not charge the battery. I ended up having to hook my Schumacher car charger up, to bring the battery back to life. This is a battery maintainer, only. Not a charger.
customer_reviews.author: William Erb

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Car's Battery Charged
customer_reviews.text: I have a hobby car (Mustang) that we only drive every couple of months. The security system slowly drains the battery and sometimes the car won't start without a jump or a quick charge. Since I started using this battery tender, the battery has stayed fully charged....and with no problems overcharging the battery. It senses the battery's charge and automatically switches off when the battery is at full charge. The unit is small, unobtrusive, and easily tucks out of the way while in use with the hood closed.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great charger
customer_reviews.text: Good quality unit keeps my car's battery charged and ready to start when I need it. I definitely recommend installing the included quick connect adapter; this should be easy on most cars which provide a screw terminal on the positive battery cable and a separate ground nearby. I always plug in the charger when I park the car, so the battery's charge is always maintained at the highest charge level. High amp output isn't important to maintain a charge (rather than charge a very low or dead battery) so 1.25 amps is more than enough, unless your car has a parasitic drain that is discharging the battery.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisA

customer_reviews.title: Ruined a couple of batteries
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as I thought it would be good to maintain batteries over the winter months. Ive used it a few times since purchased in 2011. It didnt seem to work well . 2 12v batteries got very hot and didn't work after using this maintainer on them. one was a year old and would no longer hold a charge. I selected this one because of the good reviews and hearing the brand name before. Perhaps a got a faulty unit. I am now trying a schumacher brand maintainer. review to come
customer_reviews.author: Chad D. Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Keeps things topped up
customer_reviews.text: I have a car that doesn't get driven during the winter and only driven a couple times a week (maybe) other times of the year. This keeps the battery charged up and ready to go when I want to drive it. It also will charge a fully drained battery (assuming it's not completely dead) but don't expect it to be charged quickly. Depending on how drained it might take a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about these, but I owned a couple that never worked well. An old-timer at the local auto repair shop told me to get this one, and it works perfectly as a tender, or to charge a dead battery. You should know however, that any lead-acid battery that runs too low, or spends too much time uncharged, will not be rechargeable. You have to be careful and keep them charged up - with this, you can!
customer_reviews.author: WuLiMaster

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge a completely dead battery.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a waste of money, it won't charge a very low or dead battery, the amazon page fails to mention this even though it states in the manual that the battery must have atleast 3 volts left or it won't charge at all. Had to return this piece of trash and borrow someones "real" charger to get my car working again from a very cold winter.
customer_reviews.author: m lei

customer_reviews.title: Test yours the day you get it!
customer_reviews.text: As with others my unit was dead practically out of the box. Since it took a good 3 or 4 weeks to install by the time I returned to the remote location and found the issue I couldn't return the item because it was out of the 30 Amazon return period. I'll try the manufacturer but others are having problems getting them to respond so I have little hope. Funny...The other one I have of these has been in constant service for 2 years and working great.
customer_reviews.author: NorrisFreak

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these now, one on my motorcycle and one on one of my cars thats in the garage more that out right now. Since I bought the second one, that should be a good review itself. These chargers work great! I would highly recommend them as they have everything you need, even cable extensions when required to go a bit longer due to things like a power plug in a non-convenient location.
customer_reviews.author: CurtisR

customer_reviews.title: Try it as soon as you get it.
customer_reviews.text: Not working I bought it and put it away for awhile and when I open it an try to use it it don't work I follow the instruction and nada it didn't work I'm sad because I have bought several different ones from the same brand and they all work perfect I got this one for my car that I use only several time a yera5and for my surprise battery was not even charged and I have a new batteri5 in the car manufacturers please help! I still need a working one
customer_reviews.author: antonio jaime

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked for less than 30 days --I contacted the vendor for a replacement --after 3 weeks I have received NOTHING and expect at this point to NEVER see a replacement! DO NOT BUY THIS UNIT
customer_reviews.author: Westdc

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My car is in the garage most of the time as I do not drive much. I was going out and starting up my car every 2-3 days so the battery would not die. Even with that, I had to use jumpers multiple times because of a dead battery before I got this Battery Tender. Now I no longer have to waste gas letting the car idle in the driveway. The car starts up first try every time now. Simple to use and monitor. Recommend it highly. The only con is that the cord is short but they do sell extensions (the cord from the battery to the Battery Tender).
customer_reviews.author: Julie M.

customer_reviews.title: Am recommending to all my family, friends and radio enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: I have two Plus models. One for maintaining extra radio batteries I installed in our SeaDoo Sportster separate from the engine batt. The Second maintains a lead acid gel cell for two amateur radio transceivers and the there isn't a whisper of noise from the supply in either receiver. Excellent design on Deltran's part! The icing on the cake for me was when one unit failed after several years and I called up to see if it could be repaired at a reasonable price, they told me the unit was STILL under warranty! I shipped it back and they shipped me a brand new unit. Very impressive product and support! Heads and shoulders above the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: EASY to use, anyone can do it...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this and so does my 1999 BMW Z3. Car has over 200,000 miles so she is just my pleasure car now BUT in doing so I was always having to jump the battery before using...NOT fun and not good for her. Got that Genius thing advertised...Car ate it right up. Hmmm...so after doing some research I found this. My battery is in the trunk so all I had to do is put it in the corner, pull the light bulb, close the trunk and plug it in stinking out under the cover...starts EVERY time now
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: opened and not legal
customer_reviews.text: I cannot comment on the functionally of this product. The hard plastic case it comes in had been cut open then taped. On the bottom of the package was a large red round sticker that says "Illegal to sell in California and Oregon". I live in California. Why would amazon allow a product like this to be sold?
customer_reviews.author: Sactokid

customer_reviews.title: Great battery maintainer
customer_reviews.text: I use Deltran Battery Tenders on all of my low use vehicles including the car, motorcycle, and lawn tractor. Once you bolt the included quick connect pigtails to the battery, it only takes a couple of seconds to connect or disconnect the tender. The tender ensures the battery is always fully charged but never over charged, and runs automatic maintenance cycles to make the battery last. I typically get 4-5 years on my motorcycle and lawn tractor batteries. It really does pay for itself over time. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Green

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: The Battery tender plus that I received, After I connected it to a battery and got a red & green light flashing back and forth. I figured out that it was the extension cable that came with the Battery tender plus (one of the plugs was on backwards). I contacted Battery Tender and was told that an extension cable didn't come with the Battery Tender plus. I replied that it sure was in the packet that I received, They still insisted that no extension cable comes with the tender. I still have a defective cable, that they say I don't have. I am every unhappy with there customer service. FYI it's made in China
customer_reviews.author: RON RUHL

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great with my bike
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great with my bike, car, truck. Not the fastest but its meant to do a overnight charge and trickle it so it wont die in the cold. Make sure to get a couple 25' extension cables or a 50' since the one it comes with means it will sit outside with the car. i have it in my basement next to the car and drilled hole out to driveway.
customer_reviews.author: dontcrossme

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my truck battery ready to go.
customer_reviews.text: I use my truck infrequently, mostly in snowy conditions. As a result keeping the battery charged was a problem. This unit was highly recommended by a co-worked and it has kept my truck battery ready to go when ever I need it. I have also use this battery tender to "recondition" the battery in my sons car after the dome light was inadvertently left on over several days.
customer_reviews.author: Robertweb

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell ...
customer_reviews.text: I was only getting about 2 years out of my Bosch batteries, so I bought this to keep them topped up. I am using it about twice a week and on a new battery, it recharges to the max in no time. Time will tell if it makes any difference to the battery life, but the unit is very well-made ... solid ... and has a great 10-year warranty. I did buy the 12' extension cable. This enables me to leave the charger on a shelf in the garage and just run the extension out to the battery. Also, I have the ring connectors permanently attached to the battery, for ease/speed of connection.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a classic car driven sparingly. Wanted to keep battery fully charged without worry of damaging battery leaving something connected to battery long term. This battery tender is exactly what is needed. No worries of overcharging or damaging battery when leaving connected long term. Indicator lights are very helpful for a quick visual check of battery condition and whether battery tender is charging or maintaining the battery. Recommend long battery connector cable so the battery tender doesn't have to be very near the car when connected. Using the quick connect/disconnect cable to hook up to battery makes connecting and disconnecting only take a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plug & play, good charger for motorcycle/car
customer_reviews.text: So absolutely easy to use, literally no way to mess it up. If you attach the battery end wrong it lets you know, the pigtail is one way only so easy, to start it simple as plug into the wall. Charges my diesel sedan with no problems as well as my motorcycle. The cord could be longer but battery tender sells a long 25ft cord for relatively cheap. Not very water resistant so keep it dry and indoors, mine had a Florida sprinkle hit it and doesn’t work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: A product that actually does what it says what it can do all the time
customer_reviews.text: Battery Tender Plus 021-0128,1.25 was the best purchase I've made on Amazon I live in Michigan last year I had to jump my older Cub Cadet all the time Then i bought the Battery Tender Plus still same battery from last year and it starts every time and we have had some really cold temps this year and our fair share of snow Thanks Amazon for selling this product So nice to have in the garage from here on
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: it won't let you down
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these for years....lawn mower and brush cutter during the off-season. But with the Covid19 pandemic and the more or less "cowering" in place, I decided to get another one for my car....which I drive maybe once a week ....great decision.....it was starting to take too long to turn over......would recommend without hesitation. And btw....they are NOT waterproof....so if it's raining, either put it under the hood, or disconnect it.....
customer_reviews.author: dog res q r

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Friends of mine have purchased cheap battery minders from tool outlets and internet sites. They have either wrecked their batteries or did not keep the battery charged. This charger works perfectly and while not inexpensive always works perfectly. You can connect it incorrectly and the flashing lights tell you to correct the connections. There’s never any sparks which is important since batteries generate explosive hydrogen. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pilot500

customer_reviews.title: Deltran got it right
customer_reviews.text: I've had Battery Tenders for some years now, but my prior units were programmed for specific battery types, such as Gel or AGM. The very early ones also "fried" when polarity was accidentally reversed. This unit now has programming for all common types, except Li-On. Manual indicates these even compensate based on ambient temperature. With SoCal heat in the summer, I'm certain these pay for themselves with extended battery life. Keep one on M/C year round. 2nd unit goes on the car when not used weekly.
customer_reviews.author: GSXR

customer_reviews.title: Same results as using a turnip to charge battery
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up to charge my truck battery, steady red light. Battery still wasn’t fully charged by midnight, so I took it off and was going to resume the next morning. Impossible to get the red light from flashing. I must have received a lemon. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: R & M

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1990 Caddy Hearse. This vehicle is HUGE and was having a hard time holding a charge through out the winter since I no longer drive it daily (fuel expenses). I bought this (skeptical) as it was suggested to me by someone who stores an RV. I hooked it up to my Caddy with an almost completely dead battery and left it on for a day. The next day I unhooked it and the car started right up. I am very impressed with this product as I did a lot of research on them and other trickle batteries. This item is very small! But I would HIGHLY recommend. Will update if there are any changes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SOLVED MY PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: Had no issue in the last 2 months. I've been having the car sit for weeks before I would need to go anywhere, then having to brake out the big charger just to start it (radio equipment was draining the battery). Got tired of that real quick. So I decided to give it a try. It does its job, charges to about 14.2v, then maintains at about 13.2v. (for me) After a few days the voltage will drop down to about 12.7v and it will charge backup to 13.2v. Now, when I need to go, I unplug, unhook and go. SOLVED MY PROBLEM.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, when I take my Shelby GTEcoboost for a run, I bring it home and immediately plug it in. This is the best way to save and preserve you car (or whatever else you want/need to charge) battery. When I sold my last Shelby, I sold the car WITH the same type/style "Battery Tender Plus Charger and Maintainer" that I have now. The new owner of my car was delighted to get it and that is why I got one for this car also.
customer_reviews.author: nascarbilly

customer_reviews.title: works at first, then dies
customer_reviews.text: Works the first 3 months, after that, barely does a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Wolf Pack

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Used on my 1990 Camaro. Car only gets driven a couple times a month. Battery would be very low and not have enough juice to start vehicle or operate door poppers properly (has shaved handles). Bought this charger and it took about 24 hours to bring it to full charge. Now I have no issues starting or opening doors. Only problem is the o-ring pig tail connector isn’t long enough. I need to add some length to it so I can run it down from the battery tray so I can plug in without popping hood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: Useless. I attached this to a well charged battery and left it for 2 months. Came back an it won't even try to start the vehicle. The light was red when I first connected it to indicate charging, the next day it was green and stayed green for storage mode. The battery wasn't connected to the vehicle while it was connected to this device. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: STeve

customer_reviews.title: Battery tender that doesn't put out voltage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last fall to maintain my motorcycle battery over the winter. Cold and wet spring and busy summer meant July before checking the battery and getting the motorcycle out. Battery was dead. Took the battery in to get check at local battery shop, battery takes a charge just fine. Told me to test the Battery Tender Plus and behold, doesn't output any voltage even though the light shows "charging".
customer_reviews.author: gumby

customer_reviews.title: Great you can’t go wrong with these
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for so many years I do not remember. Needed another one as we now have three cars. Did not think twice about buying this as they have never failed me. Travel a lot for months at a time and have always come back to a charged battery. One of my cars gets driven less than 500 miles a year so it stays hooked up to the battery when not driving. The other cars get hooked up when we travel.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Battery Tender
customer_reviews.text: Considering its winter in PA, my bike is hooked up to this tender as I right this. Comes with everything you need to get going, just connect the cable to the battery and leave it attached ( I put a little piece of waterproof velcro on the connector and I just have it placed tucked above the side cover) I ride a Triumph Scrambler and have only used this type of tender. It is my third one as I left one outside in the rain by accident and dropped the other from about 4 feet, however since the price is so great it is not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan R.

customer_reviews.title: Reassuring regarding car battery
customer_reviews.text: For me, there's nothing more inconvenient and frustrating than having a dead battery in my car, whether at home or away. Since I'm driving much less frequently due to COVID-19 restrictions, this charger gives me the reassurance that my car's battery is in the good working order. It's easy to use/install and provides visual information regarding the status of the charge. So glad to have bought this.
customer_reviews.author: geek0130

customer_reviews.title: Shortened battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery tender did keep my car's battery up to full charge, but my batter's life is only about 2 years. The battery I purchase for my car has a 3 year full replacement warranty, and with three batteries I have had to replace the batteries after two years. I have two of these chargers and both operate the same. I have another car, that I use often, and the battery is now 5 years old - the same type battery I have on my car with the battery tender/charger.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Charger !
customer_reviews.text: Due to the virus crisis, one of our two family cars would not start twice due to inactivity. After extensive reviews, I decided on the Battery Tender Plus. Very simple to operate and it charged the battery to full status in about 24 hours. I also purchased the 25-foot extension cord so I could use any receptacle in my two car garage. So far, very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: A M V B

customer_reviews.title: safe and effective
customer_reviews.text: Was using my neighbor's very old charger, and it was taking forever, plus getting very warm. Did not dare leave it overnight, as I was supposed to ( 12 hour charge.... to full battery) , so I gave his back and bought this. Left it overnight as it was not heating up, and has safety so it will not overcharge. Hours later, my battery was fully charged, and charger never even got warm. Far safer !!
customer_reviews.author: gearchick

customer_reviews.title: Better than a "charger".
customer_reviews.text: During the winter months when my hot rods aren't being driven, I use Battery Tenders to hold a charge on the batteries. I leave them hooked up and in spring, when it's time to do some cruising, I turn the key and the cars light right off. Battery Tenders won't overcharge your battery-- unlike a typical battery charger. They charge using a "float" system, allowing the battery to discharge slightly before turning on and recharging. These are great for your seasonally driven cars, boats, bikes or RVs. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Lola Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Convenient size and priced accordingly
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received this product promptly, this is not only a capable battery charger but is also a battery tender which will allow me to leave my riding mower battery hooked up during the Winter and ready for immediate usage should the situation arise.All indicator lights that monitor battery condition are long life LED's and the included power cords permit freedom of placement for the charger unit.
customer_reviews.author: garry v

customer_reviews.title: This unit is well made, and works just as ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit is well made, and works just as advertised -- and it sure has helped. I don't drive a lot, and the cold weather takes a toll on my battery, but with this unit I feel confident that the charge is always there. My only critique is to suggest that they put an on/off switch so that you did not need to plug and unplug it every time you connect and disconnect it. But that is a minor issue for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent battery tender
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my corvette because the battery runs down when it’s parked for long periods. After I got it started and drove a little I ordered and connected the tender to my battery and it fully recharged it and maintains the battery. No more problems. I did have to order the cable extension as the one that comes with it is not nearly long enough to reach car from the shelf it sits on. Easy setup and removal when I drive the car. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Battery Maintainer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep the battery in a rarely used BMW 330Ci from dying. The battery had a tendency to get low after just a week or so, but now that it's on the Tender I've had no issues with it. The car is rarely driven, but now I don't need to worry about doing anything to the battery when it comes time to actually drive it...I just get in and go. I used a multimeter to measure the charge of the battery, and the Tender keeps it consistently at the same voltage, which lets me know it's doing it's job, and doing it well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Trustable, Reliable, and Proven
customer_reviews.text: Nothing negative to say. Yes, works that good. I proven it because I've bought one back in 2000, for my Harley Chopper, and used the screwed on cable coupler that way I didn't have to remove the seat. but someone borrowed mine and I've never seen it again. Oh well, but it does save your battery. especially if you don't use the battery for any given time.
customer_reviews.author: Koa Boy

customer_reviews.title: Good charger.
customer_reviews.text: It charges the battery at a very low speed, I think that is good for the battery. First time I borrowed it from friend, and this time I bought it. No issue at all and not as what was described in all the 1 star top reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on all my batteries
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work like it should however this one will not work on a couple of vehicles of mine unless you disconnect the cables from the vehicle. My older older battery tender will work with cables attached.I contacted the manufacturer and they were no help whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to set up. As others have mentioned, the cord is short, but reaches an extension cord that lies next to the passenger front side of the car (battery is on the driver's side). Has kept my son's Saab battery maintained while he is away at college. I'm quite pleased. Have been using it for about 6 weeks. If I have problems in the future I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Brain King

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work, I have purchased many battery tender with this brand but lately I notice it doesn't work, I've installed one on my generator and another one on my utv and every time I tried to start them the battery is weak. I test my batteries with a volt meter and Maybe one reason is the batteries shows 13volt and the charger's output is only 12volt, you can't charge a 13V battery with a 12V charger and I don't mind if it's made in China
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I owned this model for 8 years now and it still works like a top
customer_reviews.text: If you have an AGM type battery or batteries, this is the one you need. I owned this model for 8 years now and it still works like a top. I purchased a second one, so I can charge two batteries in my side by side ATV at at time. ( I use this machine heavily during winter, so I have a two battery system) Plugged in the new charger immediately and it worked as it is supposed to work. Based on my experience with the first one, I can only recommend this charger. It also works on wetcell batteries, but I only use it on my AGM (sealed batteries)
customer_reviews.author: Kurt B

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I have a car strictly for leisure driving and found the battery would struggle or die between weeks of car usage. I was aware of the battery life degradation that was happening and knew about battery tenders, so I purchased this one recommended by my co-worker. My battery was almost dead and this charged it up in just over 24hr! It's keeping it topped up which I'm thrilled by. And for the price, it's completely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Worked the first time I hooked it up. But after that did not work. Red charging light would not turn to green like it was supposed to. Contacted Deltran customer service. They responded quickly and were helpful in determining the unit was defective. Sent back to Amazon for a refund which was a very easy process.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Aiken

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets!
customer_reviews.text: Virtually overnight delivery - to a rural address! Great job. Bought this to replace my original unit which I have used for many years without even a hint of a problem. Tried others over the years but none compare to, or endure as long, as this great little wonder. Immune to extremes of cold and heat, even buried under snow at one time. I feel assured that this new unit will make me as happy as his forerunner.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Slow but Steady
customer_reviews.text: This product really saved me a lot of aggravation. I have a second car that I don't use very often and the battery has died a couple of times. AAA boosted the battery the first time but it soon died shortly thereafter. The second time AAA gave me a boost I immediately attached the Tender and was surprised it still took more than 48 hours to get to full charge. Bottomlne, it's slow but steady and I not not worried about the car going dead on me again!!
customer_reviews.author: Ble$$ed

customer_reviews.title: Went up in smoke (literally) after 5 years
customer_reviews.text: This is a long term review. After 5 and a half years this item has stopped working. It did a great job while it lasted and I thought it would have lasted longer. Now the bad. When it went out some inside mist have burned up because it filled my garage with smoke and a burnt smell. Im glad it wasn’t close to anything flammable and it occurred between trips through the garage and not while out of town.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Not a TRICKLE charger......better
customer_reviews.text: Most if not all "trickle" chargers apply a CONSTANT small amp current to keep the cells charged. this is known to shorten battery life especially in lead-acid applications.. This charger cycles off and on as needed which avoids the slow constant degradation of the plates in most auto, motorcycle, and deep cycle lead-acid batteries by constant charging.
customer_reviews.author: gmano050

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I let my tractor sit too long without starting, and had to boost it. How dumb is that? I bought a Battery Tender, and it keeps the battery fully charged. I have a smaller version on my riding lawn mower. If you have a tractor, antique car, or any vehicle that doesn't get started and run on a regular basis, it's an absolute no brainer to have one of these things.
customer_reviews.author: R. Strickland

customer_reviews.title: This battery charger is perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: My alternator sporadically charges my battery so when the car sits over the weekend, it won't start on Monday morning due to the battery never getting fully charged by the alternator. Alternators are quite pricey and this will enable me much more time to save for the new alternator. The lights on the charger are very clear and give you an indication of the charging progress. I really like its small size and mostly how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Bretski

customer_reviews.title: Died after 7 months. Buy this other one instead.
customer_reviews.text: Was always used inside. Died after 7 months. Warranty terms make the warranty useless. Buy this one instead. It costs a fraction of the price. I have 3 of them for almost 3 years and not one has failed.  It has the exact same charge algorithm.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This tender is great to leave on my car that doesn't get driven much. It won't overcharge the battery but keeps monitoring charge then instantly switches to top the battery off. if you tap the terminals together it doesn't spark making it super safe. The charger does everything for you with no set up required. The only downside is that it can not revive a completely dead battery
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Been pleased so far, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So I haven't had these terribly long but its been a great work horse in my time with it. It runs quietly, it does the job it's supposed to do, and it's very easy to use. The lights on the outside are easy to read and know the status of your battery. Whether that's charging or in a storage mode state It has done some battery charging as well as tending in my time with it. I've used it to help recondition a lawn mower battery and it is currently acting as a battery tender on my project car
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase - No Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: This charger was wonderful up until today. Less than 1 year in and it is dead as a door-nail. I will be reaching out to customer support on Monday, but based off of previous reviews, I will not get my hopes up. For the manufacturer to not support such a quality product is a shame. In theory, this battery tender has many advanced features that I believe 100% support the purchase price. We just need the company to support us as well after trusting in their products. We shall see....
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: We have a older one that works much better
customer_reviews.text: Unit became very hot and didn’t seem to work as well as the description. We will not be using and sending back. We have a older one that works much better
customer_reviews.author: Redalloggio

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Item was just as described, packaged well for shipment and arrived in a timely manner. We have a horse farm in the north east USA and winters can take a toll on the batteries in our vehicles and machines. These have dramatically extended the battery life for us and we have not had to replace a battery yet that these maintain for us. A must have
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A. Eick

customer_reviews.title: Battery Tender failed me!
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for the first 4 months (June-Oct. 2016). Then next time left it until June 2017. Car battery was totally dead and would not charge. Had battery checked and it's totally bad. Battery was 1.5 years old. AAA analyst suspects tender damaged battery. So had to buy a new car battery and am now afraid to plug tender in to the new battery.
customer_reviews.author: PBbuysonline

customer_reviews.title: Very good battery tender
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. I’m currently using the alligator clips to connect to my battery, because I want to buy new cable terminals this spring. I check the battery every week and every time, the cables and wiring are cool to touch. Once I get new battery cable ends, I’ll use the supplied pigtail with the quick connection setup. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Reliability 100% every time!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these chargers for years, my first purchase was in 1981. I use them to keep my vehicles (car, truck & Harley)ready to go at any moment. Before I retired I used them to prevent being late for work. Nothing worse than getting in a vehicle and the battery is shot and I’m going to be late for work. I have three Battery Tenders and I wouldn’t use anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Harry I. Decker

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS AN AWESOME PRODUCT, MY CAR HAS AN ELECTRICAL DRAIN THAT NOBODY CAN FIND, SO I NEED THIS TO KEEP THE BATTERY AT OPTIMUM CHARGE IN ORDER FOR IT TO START EVERY DAY. I JUST LEAVE THIS ON ALL THE TIME, PLUG IT IN AND NEVER HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT JUMPING A DEAD BATTERY AGAIN. I DID HAVE TO PURCHASE THE EXTENTION CABLE SO I COULD LEAVE IT INSIDE MY CAR WITH THE CABLE OUTSIDE TO THE BATTERY, GREAT PRODUCT, THANK YOU
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good option to keep batteries charged.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to keep a charge on the battery of a car that isn’t driven often. I also use it to top off the riding mower battery during winter. It works well for both of these purposes. Just don’t be in a hurry. A mostly depleted 12v takes days to fully charge. This is not an item useful for a jumpstart.
customer_reviews.author: B. Marshall

product_meta.title: Battery Tender Plus Charger and Maintainer: 12V, 1.25 Amp Powersport Battery Charger and Maintainer for Motorcycles, ATVs, UTVs, and More - Smart 12 Volt Automatic Float Chargers by Deltran - 021-0128
feature_bullets: STAY CHARGED: The 1.25 amp charger provides a full charge to your powersports battery before automatically switching to float mode to maintain proper voltage levels without overcharging the battery

EASY, FAST CHARGING: A low maintenance design to be quick and easy to use even in small storage spaces, our powersport charger and maintainer charges as fast or faster than any 3 amp charger available
EXTENDED BATTERY LIFE: Compatible with lead-acid, flooded, and sealed maintenance free batteries (AGM and gel cell) and ideal for use in long term storage to provide and maintain an optimal charge

MONITOR POWER LEVELS: Solid state two-color LED light indicates the state of the charge and if the battery voltage drops too far under load, ISM adaptive charging will resume full charger output power
SAFE AND SECURE: Our battery charger and maintainer is spark-proof during lead connection and automatically detects reverse polarity to ensure a correct, locked-in connection before providing power

specifications.Model: Plus 12V, 1.25 AMP Smart Battery Charger and Maintainer
specifications.Cover Included: 1.25A automatic charger and maintainer, Alligator clips, Ring harness, Quick disconnect
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars7,608 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars

categories: Jump Starters, Battery Chargers & Portable Power
